intro: Uragoga lepidocarpa, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant has strap-like, evergreen leaves that are often used in ornamental gardening. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Uragoga lepidocarpa is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
